channel.title: Gfx graphics help plz
channel.description: i've never tried changing the graphics for things like special att fishing emote sorta thing before and i dont know where to put them or how to test them so please give me a step by step "tutorial" on how to plz :|

item.title: Gfx graphics help plz
item.dc:creator: @mage_owner mage_owner
item.description:
@mage_owner wrote:

ok lol…i didn’t download his, so i didn’t know what it has and doesn’t have
but lets say you wanted to change the gfx on the door in dummys
you would search for:

case 1531:

you would see something similar to this:

case 1531: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("oooh Yeaahhh Hit that door"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(1658); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[18]), 18); stillgfx(###, absY, absX); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;
and you would change the ### to the gfx you would cast…I thinkit might be the

setAnimation(1658) but not sure

Read full topic

item.title: Gfx graphics help plz
item.dc:creator: @mage_owner mage_owner
item.description:
@mage_owner wrote:

Look for the case you want to change the emote on…
you should see a stillgfx(###,,) or somethin like that…
leave the ,and alone…but change the ### to the gfx you would want…
save, compile, run
I have attached a list of gfx too lol

Read full topic

item.title: Gfx graphics help plz
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

add these commands


else if (command.startsWith("still") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("le hawtz"))
{
int id = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));
stillgfx(id, absY, absX);
sendMessage("Testing GrApHiCs cODE!!");
}
else if (command.startsWith("projectile") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin")) {
int spellz = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(11));
createProjectile(absY, absX, 0, 3, 50, 160, spellz, 43, 31, 0);
}

now you would put
::still ##
to test a still one
::projectile ## to test a moving one
to put it under something

stillgfx(##, absY, absX);

= gfx number

enjoy

Read full topic
